DataElement.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Screening Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study related to the assessments of activities that produce an effect, or intended to alter the course of a disease as outlined in the clinical trial protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Screening Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._A systematic examination or assessment._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Property.preferredDefinition: A systematic examination or assessment.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there an anticipated need for surgical intervention within the first three cycles (3 months)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has received more
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received more than a cumulative dose of 350 mg/m2 of doxorubicin, is patient being enrolled at the discretion of the Coordinating Center PI with a screening echocardiogram?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has brain metastases, is complete surgical resection clinically appropriate?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there an anticipated need for major surgical procedures during the course of the study or core biopsy within 7 days prior to D1 therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior radiotherapy or had a condition that for any reason would contribute to radiation dose that would exceed tolerance of normal tissues, at discretion of the treating physician?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are remaining standard treatment options unlikely to be effective in the opinion of the treating physician, or patient is felt to be ineligible for such therapies or the patient refuses such therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any prior therapy, for their prostate cancer, with surgery, radiation, and/or chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient expected to be on a planned and/or maintained ADT treatment for medical castration throughout the study unless the patient has had orchiectomy by surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patients have received a cumulative dose of greater than 350 mg/m2 of anthracycline (regardless of cardioprotectant), is their ejection fraction measured by an echocardiogram within normal institutional limits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If applicable, does patient meet the parameters for apheresis per institutional guidelines?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received a cumulative dose of greater than or equal to 350 mg/m2 of anthracycline (regardless of cardioprotectant), is  the ejection fraction measured by an echocardiogram within normal institutional limits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has evidence of cardiac abnormalities, has patient agreed to undergo screening EKG, echocardiogram, CPK and troponin levels as determined by the PI and evaluated by Cardiology, prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient meet the parameters for apheresis per institutional guidelines?

DataElement.changeDescription: 2020-8-3 AQT added for P10398. AK 11/30/16 approved/released. 11/16/16 tt, 10005.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.2 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002682. ak
